meanings.definition: To make a copy or reproduction of something.
meanings.sent1: She was facsimileing the important document for her boss.
meanings.sent2: I will be facsimileing these notes for the meeting tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The photocopier was facsimileing so fast, it seemed like magic!
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a photocopier, facsimileing every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hand moved swiftly, facsimileing the masterpiece with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of sending a document via fax machine.
meanings.sent1: The facsimileing of the contract was done quickly.
meanings.sent2: I need to do some facsimileing to send these papers to the client.
meanings.sent3: The office was buzzing with the sound of facsimileing all day.
meanings.sent4: The fax machine worked tirelessly, facsimileing documents without rest.
meanings.sent5: The facsimileing of the report saved time and paper for the team.

meanings.definition: A duplicate or exact copy of something.
meanings.sent1: He kept a facsimileing of the map in case he lost the original.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a facsimileing of the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The twins looked so alike, they could be mistaken for facsimileings.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a facsimileing of her mother's infectious joy.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflected a facsimileing of her tired expression after a long day.
